GDG | IoT | Women Tech Makers | PWA 

Connect talented developers giving them the chance to exchange ideas, teach their skills and acquire new ones.

GDG Moi University Team

2017.

name: Progressive Web App (PWA)  Hack 2017
description: This will entail Hands-on Progressive Web App Development. Using Firebase, Chrome Developer Tools and Github.

name: GDG DevFest Rift Valley 2017
description:
Each DevFest is inspired by and uniquely tailored to the needs of the developer community that hosts it.

While no two events will be exactly alike, each event will, at its core, be powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen and #DevFest Rift Valley is no EXCEPTION!

DevFest Rift Valley Web App - More Details (https://devfest.gdgmoi.com/)

With the I/O still fresh in minds, we aim at bringing together developers from the three Google Developer Groups ( Moi | Kabarak | Egerton ) to connect, engage, share and teach their skills and build amazing things together! What you need! ( REQUIRED) RSVP for a ticket and carry your laptop and laptop charger! You'll be set! DevFest Rift Valley AGENDA • What's DevFest?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YB9HW9qmIdQ&index=5&list=PLbIFhpS0kD8Gf4w02Xbn_fzd6ZpMq1ghm

• Keynote Speech • What are GDGs ?

• Overview of Google Developer Offerings

• Getting started Firebase for Android -room A

• Firebase for Web - room B

• PWA - room C

• Android Things, Internet of Things - IoT - room D

• Hackathon recap (Eldoret Tech Week)

• Penetration Testing 101 & Introduction to Google CTF’s - room C

• Fireside Chat - Africa & Technology

• Cyber Security - Web

• Party, Eldoret Town Mark your calendar! Cheers! Be THERE! GDG DevFest Rift Valley '17 Team Follow us on G+ now (https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/100413733864528613887/+GdgmoiuniAppspotmain)
how_to_find_us: From Eldoret Town,  if using PSV,  board MU SACCO Matatus or if you have private transport means, drive along Eldoret - Nakuru Highway, on reaching Cheptiret Trading Center, You'll see a bill board leading you to Moi University, Main Campus

name: Google Cloud Study Jam Eldoret
description:
• What we'll do
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

• What to bring
Laptops, Laptop Chargers and Power Extensions.

• Important to know

1. We ONLY have at most 50 Slots for the Study Jam.

2. Kindly RSVP only if you will be able to participate to completion in the study Jam so that those willing to participate don't miss the slots, thank you!

Venue changes if any, will be communicated in time.

name: International Women's Day (IWD) Eldoret 2018
description:
• What we'll do
Building a New Horizon - The Women Techmakers Global Event Series Celebrating International Women's Day - Eldoret

• What to bring
Laptop, Laptop Charger and a Power Extension

• Important to know
Make sure to RSVP to attend.

name: GDD India Extended Eldoret
description:
GDG India Extended Eldoret.

All about GDG India 2017 and building best web experiences with progressive web apps. We're meeting to collaborate and create teams.

name: "Build Actions for Your Community" Eldoret

venue.name: St.Luke’s Conference Hall
venue.address_1: St.Luke's Orthopaedics and Trauma Hospital. Nandi Road Next Opposite School Of Dentistry

description:
• What we'll do
“Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to GDG communities worldwide. This offers opportunities to developers attending these events to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or your hometown. This way, they can build something in an area that they care about or are interested in.

• What to bring
Laptop, Laptop Charger, Power Extension Cable

• Important to know
Venue changes may occur and communicated.

name: Google I/O Extended 2018 Eldoret
description:
• What we'll do
I/O features hands-on learning, Google's latest developer products, and technical talks given by the engineers who are developing our latest APIs and tools–plus a few surprises along the way and I/O Extended 2018 Eldoret will be bringing the same experience to you! Be THERE!

• What to bring
Laptops, Laptop Charger, Power Extension Cables.

• Important to know
Ticket RSVP will be announced in time, venue changes may occur etc. Just stay ready! We shall recall your seat reservation at 10.00 AM to allow those without to RSVP if need be.
how_to_find_us: While in Moi University, Main Campus, head to the Margaret Thatcher Library's Conference Room. Keep time.

name: Women Techmakers Eldoret Get-together
description: Our get-together Meetup for Women Techmakers. Learning of what resources are available for Women Techmakers and how we could get started scaling higher.

name: Google Cloud Next ’18 Extended Eldoret
description:
Let’s power the cloud forward together. Connect with big thinkers and even bigger doers at Next ’18 to create a cloud that can help us all in new, impactful ways.

What to bring?

- Bring a laptop + charger -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.

What to expect?

- We have good swag, a whole day of self placed codelabs on Googlr Cloud Platform + Food + Photos & Pre #DevFest18 #DevFestRV video shoot.
how_to_find_us: We shall be at the Administration Block, Main Campus. Once at the Admin Block, ask for CERM-ESA Conference Facility, it's on the first floor.

name: GDG DevFest Rift Valley 2018
description:
GDG DevFests are large, community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies

FAQs : https://twitter.com/devfestRV Web App : https://devfest.gdgeldoret.com
how_to_find_us: From Nakuru, head to Egerton University, Main Campus, Njoro.

name: GDG DevFest Rift Valley 2019
description: Community-run developer events happening around the globe focused on community building and learning about Google’s technologies.

name: Cloud Study Jam 2019
description:
Certification // Cloud Architecture

1. Getting Started with Cloud KMS

2. Networking 101

3. Set Up Network and HTTP Load Balancers

Lab details : http://bit.ly/sj-cert

What to bring?

1. Bring a laptop and charger (Windows PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

2. Come with your alternative means of Internet access - like personal data bundle or package. We really need good internet and we can't promise a stable one depending on attendance capacity.
how_to_find_us: Eldohub new offices past Boma Inn. Feel free to reach out to Paula, Co-Lead for help +254  716 583 340
